title: The matchmaking system actively works against you climbing
body:
Currently as ranked is designed, the matchmaking actively tries to keep you from climbing. Which is wrong. It should be difficult, but it shouldnt be pushing you back harder than youre pushing it forward.

#1) The MMR on each player is not balanced accordingly.

The game by default will attempt to match you closer to your rank by MMR. So if youre 200 over the amount thats normal for your rank, it will pair you with people who are on loss streaks 200 below their rank, to balance the teams out.

Because its the same number right? Clearly they are equal in skill? WRONG. A player on a 30 winstreak from silver who meets someone on a 30 loss streak from platinum are not the same skill. One is gonna continue to climb and the other is going to continue to fall. Quit putting them together.

Just because 190 + 10 + 50 + 150 + 100 = 500 does not make that team equal against a 100 x 5 = 500 team. They are going to lose because of the two losers.

Quit puttin them together. It's not the same.

#2) Artificial difficulty in the ladder.

Promotion games make no sense. No other system in life works that way. Where you can do nothing but win games but only those three games matter, and if you lose two, doesn't matter, sucks for you.

Lets say I win/lose/lose my promos. then I win 2 more to get back into promos. Then win/lose/lose again.

Despite the fact that my win ratio is 50% better than my loss ratio, I will literally never climb. 

The idea behind artificial difficulty in promotions is ridiculous. You clearly earned yourself to get to promotions to begin with, so why do only those three games matter? If you werent capable of climbing you wouldn't have gotten there in the first place.

Look at overwatch, they don't use that stupid system, and guess what? The curve on players in ranks is how it's supposed to be.

You realize the curve of player ranks in this game makes literally no sense right? 80% of the players should not be bronze and silver. It should be gold is the bell end of the most populated while bronze is about as filled as diamond is in terms of player mass. 

#3) Why are promotional games different from normal ranked games?

This is no coincidence. Every single promotional game I have I have to do exceptionally well to pass. This normally wouldn't be a problem, but since it's promotionals you feel you have to put players with ones that have been doing exceptionally bad to 'prove themself'. Thats not how this game works.

On top of that, why does LP still calculate in promotionals? That makes literally no sense. My LP should not be changing in this time period. Its literally only a bad thing.

If you lose, you start with less LP than you came in with.

If you win, congratulations, you defied the odds and hope it doesn't go wrong the next time.



Literally the only way to fix how promotionals work is to either 

A) Compensate players by giving them free loss preventions for getting winstreaks'

This could fix the system entirely. It lets good players deal with the shitty system and does nothing for the bad ones, as it should.

B) Give you multiple tries at promotions

or C) Both of the above.

Fix your bad system please. Im out of shit to say. /rant.

Promos aren't the problem with ranked. The complete shit show of players is the problem. They halved the xp required to reach level 30. So if you get lucky and win your first 2 games you're pretty much guaranteed silver. Then, they make it virtually impossible to get demoted. So you're not going to get demoted to bronze unless you lose like 100 games in a row. This creates an environment where you're not judged by ability, but rather your ability to carry, sprinkled in with some luck of who is going to get the more shitty players on their team (you know, the autofill supports who don't even have a keystone. wut.). Then the "yolo carries" are the ones that climb. So then gold/plat is populated with the "fuck you I carried myself here" players that get mad if you try and give them advice about something they're doing wrong.

I don't know, I just think there should actually be a difference between normal games and ranked games. There currently is not. People "try new things" just as much, if not more, in ranked than they do in norms. Nothing else is like this. It's why the community is so "toxic". Because you have half the team not giving a fuck and not trying and playing something they've never played before and going 0-6-0 in lane, and you have the other half really frustrated that they're stuck wasting 45 mins of their life every time they get these people in a game. Creates a very negative environment.

Couple easy things I think we can do to make the game more competitive. #1 Require champion mastery of X level before being able to play them in ranked. Stops people from playing shit in ranked that they've never played before. #2 Reverse the stupid XP drop to hit level 30. In order to solve the bell end they need to do a complete ranked reset. Everyone starts at gold MMR, the bad people will fall and the good people will rise, and the higher ranks (plat and above) will start to be filled with people who deserve it, especially newer players.

I was brand new in overwatch, but got placed in *platinum*. You CAN be new to a game and good at it.

The ranking system isn't meant to be a bell curve, though. It's supposed to be a pyramid - the most people on the bottom with fewer and fewer people the higher up you go.

Honestly, using your "bell curve" approach seems like it would have the same problems as the current system, and potentially more. Having everyone start out in gold means both the best players and the worst players are all together. Good players can still get dragged down by crappy teammates, and bad players can still get boosted by really good teammates. 

And because you're concentrating the lowest tiers with only the absolute worst players, it will be even harder than it currently is to climb out of "elo hell" for players who get the short end of the matchmaking RNG stick when they start ranked. No no, huge misunderstanding in what you based your logic on(remember logic is NOT universal its highly conditional and individualistic if set parameters are not given to adjust): It works similarly to the following (and has been stated as such since I am just paraphrasing and adding some numbers for relational clarity): T**he match making system pairs you vs slightly better than you players **(particularly in ranked, but see promos later)**, meaning they should be 1-20% more skilled than you, at 90% skill for instance a 1% skill increase can represent 4x more QUALITY practice**(vs incorrect practice that harms your skills and reinforces errors)** than the previous 90% combined, so the "gap" seems increasingly larger the more skilled you are even tho its droping from 20% better than you to a mere 1%.**

**It primarily and foremost matches you based on your win %, plat+ has 70%+ win rate per player so if you have a high win rate you will get "shifted" to be vs "equal or more skilled opponents"** (getting trolled by challengers when you are only silver for instance)**. Once you are around 80% win rate (this is especially so if you have superb team work skills but low role skills, as it will place you much faster vs harder opponents the more "competent" you are at a team based game** (tl;dr: while a soloist or top lane might get to diamond via mechanics alone, most people sitting in diamond+ actually have fairly poor mechanics(low skill) but excellent natural team work(synergy) which is also technically a mechanical skill. coupled with good old fashioned luck of getting grouped with like minded people(you are ALSO getting group with like minded people, its just your mindset and playstyle is not compatible with a team game so your groups might be like nails on chalkboard or the equivalent of an IT group of strangers vs a group of playground sports team whom all knew each other since childhood; though do note that this does NOT work out the same 4 man or less groups (premade) but does work roughly the same in 5 v 5 premade(which doesn't really exist outside of pros)**.**

3rd During promos you are INTENTIONALLY paired with a group slightly lower than your skill(but usually in the bracket you are trying to enter!) and AGAINST a group(meaning all members on the team, vs just your heavily preferred role/lane(in the soloist example, solo top, or support, or jungle, it essentially looks at your over all statistic instead of role statistics unlike normal ranked matches) with MUCH higher skill/the logic of the algorithim is heavily favoring (probably 52-53% chance for them to win), it is working as intended that you should not progress in series (without competent help from your team mates as they are also a metric in this but it gets way wordier than this to add in all those variables) as Riot's refined match making system pairs you to have a roughly 49-51% win rate and tries very hard to pair you against opponents it THINKS (using logic) you should LOSE to, if you win, subsequent matches will get exponentially more difficult each win in the streak and your MMR will change dramatically for your promo series. On "average" you should: win 1, lose 1, win 1, then 50:50 to advance, if you win 1, win 1, win 1, promote, you either a) had excellent team mates and team work, or carried hard while micromanging the entire game. Of course you can game the match making system just as easily as it tries to exploit you and put you on a lose strict certain days. Generally if you are actually successfully climbing ladder you should be easily maintaining a 70% win rate, and not playing days you aren't.


Summed up: Your logic has a key flaw. The system is Working as Intended, you are supposed to lose your promos (according to the logic(math version btw) of the match making algorithm). 

You CAN game this by intentionally abusing the algorithms logic(lose games it thinks you are supposed to win, avoid winning games too "well"), though this only works when there is a large player pool in your grouping to work with(so diminishes in effectiveness around platinum). Another good way to game the system, is: if you are on a win streak, and suddenly enter a promos, test the waters the first promo to see if you win, if you do not STOP PLAYING that day and do not resume your promo until you get the "feeling." (your intuition mentions to you "right now is a good time to play" this is a very specific feeling and not to be confused with the "I want to" feeling (which is eerily similar but is generated by your irrational parts (ego) rather than your intuitive/logic parts) despite their similarities, DEFINITELY listen if you get the "DON'T" feeling (that strong sensation like when a monster is charging at you and you are genuinely debating to fight or flee despite your body telling you fully to flee) though this might be a rare feeling if you aren't in touch with yourself/fully tested and confident in your own limitations and accepted what you can, and cannot do.)

some asides on winning vs losing: So, the system only looks at your skill performance and potential (how you act, behave, and preform. Not how you are feeling, how well nourished you are at that time, etc), there are tons of variables you can control that it can't predict for (and why you can have a 70%+ win rate). If you consistently make mistakes, the system knows it and adjusts, if you rarely make mistakes or always play flawlessly, it will be very harsh if you are ever "not feeling at peak performance." You will get the most accurate MMR if you only play when you are preforming at your peak (look how few games logged pros have on their "main" in ranked vs when they want to "climb" the ladder again on an alternate account/learn different roles), as it will always be the most honest metric of your maximum potential, playing at ANY OTHER TIME of day/day of the month will get you a highly flawed MMR that will do everything you are complaining about encountering.
